title: Comparison of Anole species Set Member 1

content.description:
The brown anole (Anolis sagrei) is a species of lizard native to Cuba that has been introduced into the southeastern United States. The range of brown anoles in the United States has been expanding, and they are now competing with native green anoles (Anolis carolinensis). Some of the characteristics of the green and brown anoles are shown in Table 1.

TABLE 1. CHARACTERISTICS OF TWO ANOLE SPECIES

Anole Species
 Body Length
 Limb Length Relative to Body Length
 Toe Pad Size Relative to Body Length
 Cold Tolerance

A. sagrei (brown anole) 
 <math alttext="55 to 80 millimeters" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>55</mtext><mo>–</mo><mtext>80</mtext><mtext> mm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
 Long
 Intermediate
 <math alttext="30 to 35 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>30</mtext><mo>–</mo><mtext>35</mtext><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

A. carolinensis (green anole)
 <math alttext="45 to 85 millimeters" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>45</mtext><mo>–</mo><mtext>85</mtext><mtext> mm</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

 Very large
 <math alttext="25 to 30 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>25</mtext><mo>–</mo><mtext>30</mtext><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

A cladogram showing the relationships between some anole species is shown in Figure 1.

Figure 1. Cladogram of some anole species
content.question: Based on the data in Table 1, which of the following best explains the observed differences in cold tolerance between brown anoles (A. sagrei) and green anoles (A. carolinensis) in the United States?

choices.label: Brown anoles developed a tolerance for cold temperatures and passed on this acquired tolerance.
Brown and green anoles produced a hybrid species that has greater tolerance to cold temperatures.
Green anoles with greater tolerance for cold had greater reproductive success in areas with colder temperatures.
New mutations occurred in brown anoles in response to exposure to colder temperatures.

content.answer: Green anoles with greater tolerance for cold had greater reproductive success in areas with colder temperatures.

skill.text: 6.D: Explain the relationship between experimental results and larger biological concepts, processes, or theories.
